isis.stitle: POWER STEERING PUMPS LUK VT73 AND LF93 - ASSEMBLE

svcproc.title: ASSEMBLE
svcproc.para: Pumps can be assembled for right or left hand rotation as viewed from the shaft end. A pump made for left hand rotation (counterclockwise) is identified by an "L" and for right hand with an "R" in the model code. Refer to IDENTIFICATION.

note.para: These pumps must be driven in the direction of the arrows cast into the pump cam ring. If it is desired to change the direction of drive rotation, it is necessary to replace the cartridge.

caution.para: Never drive a pump in the wrong direction of rotation. Seizure may result, necessitating expensive repair.

note.para: Immerse all parts in clean hydraulic fluid to facilitate assembly.

A shaft seal driver must be used to ensure installation of the shaft seal without damage. A length of tubular round stock should be machined to proper dimensions. The ends must be square. The outside diameter of the driver should be slightly smaller than the outside diameter of the shaft seal. The inside diameter should be slightly larger than the shaft seal surface of the shaft. The length of the driver should be long enough to press the seal fully in against the shoulder.

step1.para: Make a shaft seal driver as noted above. Refer to Figure 6 and position shaft seal with spring side of seal facing the flange. Press seal in place until it engages the shoulder within the flange. This shoulder acts as a positive stop for the shaft seal. Do not overpress as damage to the shaft seal will result.
Lubricate the shaft with system fluid and slide the shaft assembly into the flange subassembly. Be careful not to damage the shaft seal and the bushing during installation.
Install the large retaining ring into the retaining ring groove of the flange subassembly. This retaining ring holds the bearing and shaft in place within the flange subassembly.
Insert the woodruff key into the shaft and tap in place with a small hammer to seat the key, when applicable.

Lubricate O-ring and back-up rings and install around the O-ring bosses in the body. Place the housing over the cartridge. Line up housing screw holes with the flange and thread four screws with washers through the housing into the flange. Cross tighten the screws to 29 to 37 ft-lbs. (40 to 50 N•m).
Install the flow control relief valve with the hex head going last into the valve bore. Make sure not to scratch the valve bore.

caution.para: Spool should slide gently. DO NOT force.

step1.para: Insert spring into the control valve bore over the hex head of the spool. Install a new O-ring on the hexagon plug and place it over the spring. Compress the spring and screw the plug into the housing. Tighten to 33 to 40 ft-lbs. (45 to 55 N•m).

warning.para: In the following step if the flow control relief valve S/A is reversed in the cover bore, the unit will malfunction and pressure will rise dangerously high. Make sure that you follow instructions exactly as noted.

step1.para: Install the body mounting flange into the bench vise with the shaft end down.
Insert pins into the flange and install wear plate with the bronze coated side up.
Obtain a seal kit for the unit. Lubricate and install O-rings into the grooves.

Insert vanes into the rotor with the radius edge toward the cam ring. Use an Arkansas stone on each vane edge and on each rotor edge to remove the burrs developed during handling. Make sure the vanes do not bind within the rotor. Lubricate and place the rotor and vanes on top of the flange with the rotor counterbore toward the flange.

Place the cam ring over the rotor and vanes. Check the model code for direction of rotation and position the arrow on the cam ring to agree with the model code (R-clockwise, L-counter- clockwise as viewed from the shaft end).
Install the pressure plate over the pins and up against the cam ring, rotor and vanes, with the bronze coated side towards the rotor.
